summary: This is a U.S. Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons inmate personal property record for Jeffrey Epstein, documenting the inventory of his personal belongings upon entry into custody. The form lists numerous personal items and includes a section for claims of missing or damaged property.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose personal property is being inventoried and recorded upon entry into federal custody. The form is filled out with his register number and details.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Property Inventory
events.description: Federal Bureau of Prisons officers inventory and record Jeffrey Epstein's personal property upon his entry into custody.

keyFacts: This is an official Bureau of Prisons form (BP-A0383) used to log an inmate's personal property.
The form is for Jeffrey Epstein, as indicated by his register number, and is dated July 31, 2009.
The document meticulously lists categories of personal items including clothing, toiletries, food, and miscellaneous belongings.
The form includes procedures for the inmate to claim discrepancies, missing, or damaged property.
The document represents a routine administrative record created during Epstein's incarceration.
